title: I don't hate the game, I hate its playerbase.
body:
I love outplaying my opponents, I love ranking up in the ladder and trying new thins out. I love it when Riot releases new mechanics into the game like turret plating, rift heralds and elemental dragons. I love winning a game that I bust my ass in and like taking the enemy by surprise.

What I don't like, is the community. 

I can't go one game anymore, especially ranked, without someone legitimately int feeding away, someone having a pissy fit, or someone spamming "Gg" by the 3 minute mark cause someone died. I can't stand it when people bicker back and forth, trying to prove who has the bigger ballsack. I can't stand it when people literally give up so easily because they didn't get their way. I can't stand seeing just constant negativity in the game.

Like I can't even remember the last time I saw a legitimate piece of courtesy or just all around politeness from a game. Nothing like "It's ok man, we all have bad games" or "Hey nice try man, you'll get them next time". That is what disgusts me, that behavior like that is looked down upon in game because of just how toxic people are. 

I shouldn't have to resort to /mute all EVERY single game, because I really wish to be able to communicate with my fucking team, but I suppose I am just asking for far too much.

Really?

Because it can't possibly be the community, right? If there is something wrong, then it must be just him, right? Look at these threads and posts dating back since League's birth that have been complaining about the toxic, childish, nearly-unbearable community that induces the  "why-the-hell-do-I-keep-playing" existential crisis nonstop. Shear numbers of dissatisfied players aside, look at how many posts have chat logs. Look at the youtube videos of matches. 

If you really think this community is perfect, and these literal tens of thousands of players are the cause of their own dissatisfaction due to being the constant... then you are part of the problem. Don't blame the victims for being victimized (which has been a major downfall of humanity since it's birth).

I don't think the community is perfect. That'd be stupid. But there are nice people and cruel people EVERYWHERE. If you literally NEVER see anyone being nice, then I would say the blame is on you for pushing the nice people away.

If you want to make a claim that 'I don't see ENOUGH Kindness', then I'd agree. The world can always use more kindness. But if you literally NEVER see any(which was the claim he made), then yes, I'd say you have some blame in the situation.

Yeah, it's pretty rough. I've made posts about this, the issue here is that players refuse to move onto other games. They know they are having a poor time and not enjoying themselves, but they're addicted after years of playing and don't know what to do with themselves if they're not playing this. I speak from experience. Played since season 4, loved the game and was super hooked, played nothing but this for years straight, when the game started going downhill in my own opinion I still continued to play. I played for the few games that I managed to enjoy and just muscled through the games that I didn't which were far more common. This resulted in me becoming toxic, inting out of frustration, doing things I never would have done before and have never done in another game. I assume this is the same for a lot of others, the community would be far better and games more enjoyable if people would realize they're not enjoying this game anymore and just move on. 

Something you should take into consideration is if you still like this game and if not, is it getting to you like I described. You say you love this game, but dislike the community, well the community is the game almost. Yes there's a lot to this game besides the players, but when you play, you have to play with others and work together to win. 

I quit partly because of the game as I said before, but also because having to rely upon and team with others resulted in the game being un-enjoyable. If I do really good but some lanes feed, then what's the point? I know my efforts do matter but it hardly ever felt that they mattered enough to make a difference. This was part of my consideration when I decided to quit the game because this directly effects the gameplay, so don't just ignore it as a separate matter. 

The game won't be changing anytime soon or ever, the community will always be toxic, so look within yourself and ask if how much you enjoy the game itself overcomes the shortcomings of the community. If not, then I say look to another game, move on like many others, there are many others great games out that don't force you to rely upon others and deal with them being toxic. Get on steam and checkout Terraria, Hollow Knight, Subnautica, Portal, Rimworld, something cheap that you can get a lot of enjoyment out of and just compare your experience. I found myself truly enjoying myself for once when I tried those games and that opened my eyes to how miserable I was in comparison when playing league.
Guess what, you are part of the player base.

I never wanted to leave bronze, but I also want a second diamond account. So I must leave the beautiful human beings of bronze. And now suffer in gold, even though I get no reward for ranking up at the moment. Except raising my mmr for next season.

I agree, the community is quite scary and toxic often. Sadly, that comes with the territory. Often, players tend to value themselves based on their games (they have to be perfect), combining this with the lack of accountability for one's actions that comes with online and you get all of this that you're talking about. When one thinks games are their way of life, the only thing that gives value to their existence, they get upset and angry when things don't go their way, and since we're online, they can take it all out on other people doing whatever they please to make others feel bad for "ruining everything" for them since they don't really have to face any consequences. Being banned comes few and far between and that doesn't affect them personally or cause them to change anything about themselves since they don't have to. They wait while their ban ticks down and take their gaming somewhere else. It's a hard, toxic cycle that's difficult to change since this behavior is institutionalized and normalized so it becomes a part of the status quo, the society, here. And once it gets there, it's extremely difficult to change and will take a while to change. These are my thoughts and observations on all of this in lieu of the social courses I'm taking as well as the obvious patterns that pop up. I hope it doesn't miss the mark, but this is what I've experienced and think about it. Hopefully it gets better, but it'll take action to change it and change comes gradually.
The thing is, most nice players just don't type so you never notice them. You only notice the guys screaming bloody murder.

(hug) Its True, there are a lot of poo poo players in here.

For what it's worth:

GG at 3 minute spammers aren't necessarily wrong, nor "giving up."

I personally say GG all the time. But the meaning isn't that I will EVER surrender (I never surrender) nor start playing in a way to sabotage the game.

Nah. I'm just "probably" Asberger's (Son is highly functioning autistic, and I've always had some relative social awkwardness, along with an all encompassing intelligence. It's likely.)

And..... I have played enough games to calculate gold values without seeing them per person in rewards, what power spikes happen when due to what my team does, and I can generally read a player on my team within 5 minutes, as to their core competencies and how that will translate into late game/mid game play. I see the math. I see the patterns. I know the champions. I know which champions who gain what shutdowns gain what opportunities and what opportunities deprived to my team because of it.

So when I say ... "GG" ...... I generally mean the math statistically has us at a loss, usually greater than 85% probability.

That doesn't mean I give up. I do gamble on that 15% or less probability of a win, and sometimes it pans out. But that doesn't make seeing the future any less stressful for the other 85%.
The worst is when you get a super toxic trolly player who then does the /all REPORT X

But now I just play norms so I can play things I want to have fun with, like Teemo and Graves bot. I just want to have fun with things and figure out what works and what doesn't. It sucks to be yelled at, and it sucks to hear it.
